member.name: M:SourceCode.Clay.SemanticVersion.Parse(System.String)
member.summary: Converts the representation of a semantic version to its structured equivalent.
member.param: A containing a number to convert.
member.returns: A equivalent to the semantic version contained in .
member.exception: is not in the correct format.

member.name: M:SourceCode.Clay.SemanticVersion.TryParse(System.String,SourceCode.Clay.SemanticVersion@)
member.summary: Converts the representation of a semantic version to its structured equivalent. A return value indicates whether the conversion succeeded.
member.param: A containing a number to convert.

When this method returns, contains the structured equivalent of the semantic version contained in , if the conversion succeeded, or if the conversion failed. The conversion fails if the parameter is null or , does not conform to the semantic version specification, or contains version components less than 0 or greater than . This parameter is passed uninitialized.
member.returns: true if was converted successfully; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:SourceCode.Clay.SemanticVersion.GetCompatabilities(SourceCode.Clay.SemanticVersion,SourceCode.Clay.SemanticVersion)
member.summary: Determines how the specified is compatible with the specified .
member.remarks: The presence of the flag indicates that is incompatible with . Any other value indicates compatability. is completely ignored.
member.returns: A value that contains information on how the values are incompatible.

member.name: M:SourceCode.Clay.StringExtensions.Left(System.String,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Returns the specified number of characters from the left of a string. Tolerates values that are too large or too small (or negative).

member.name: M:SourceCode.Clay.StringExtensions.Right(System.String,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Returns the specified number of characters from the right of a string. Tolerates values that are too large or too small (or negative).

member.name: M:SourceCode.Clay.StringExtensions.Elide(System.String,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Truncates a string to a specified width, respecting surrogate pairs and inserting an ellipsis '' in the final position. Tolerates width values that are too large, too small or negative. If the value is already smaller than the specified width, the original value is returned. If the character at the elided boundary is in a surrogate pair then the pair is treated atomically. In this case the result may be shorter than specified.
